definition: to attend/to take office/to be present (in administrative capacity)
river in Hebei
to attend (an official function)/to be present/to administer/to approach (esp. as administrator)
variant of 蒞|莅[li4], to attend
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
to secure a position/to take an official appointment
to pull out/to select/to promote
to accept a position on a provisional basis, in the absence of better qualified candidates (humble expr.)
county head magistrate (old)
one's office/place where one holds a post
variant of 捐資|捐资[juan1 zi1]
relief aid
senior provincial government official in dynastic China
Imperial scholar from the Ming Dynasty onwards
to dismiss/to lay off
until/while
local magistrate
to investigate (old)
to compile/to edit/compilation
inspector-general of province in Ming and Qing times
government sub-prefect (old)
